ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: The Product Manager, Apple News will assist in defining and marketing new features, media types, products, and services as part of the Apple News team. Strong understanding of technology, the process of software engineering and UI design, plus a keen sense of diplomacy. It is also beneficial to have a passion for digital media. Contribute to product positioning, messaging, introduction, maintenance, and/or obsolescence of these features, media types, products, and services.

ul.li: Software engineering or user-interface design experience a plus
Thorough knowledge of iOS, macOS, tvOS, watchOS; Windows and Android a plus
5+ years of experience in software product development
Very strong oral and written communication skills

div.p: Discerns new product areas to develop and assist in the development of the product line strategy. Manages the process used to define a product's features. Develops, communicates, and positions the product in relation to other products. Normally works on new product areas, many of which have great potential impact to Apple. Drives the definition of broad, complex, and high impact products for worldwide markets, assisting in the development of the product line strategy. Requires strong diplomacy skills to build consensus between competing business needs and objectives. Drives successful tradeoffs that affect cost, schedule, users, and how well the product works throughout the product life cycle. Provides product leadership from introduction through obsolescence, evaluates new technologies, articulates issues, and makes clear recommendations. Makes product positioning recommendations to management and counterparts. Drives and participates in user-experience research to identify obstacles, improve ease-of-use and customer satisfaction. Articulates research findings to management in order to impact future product direction. Creates and delivers formal presentations and conducts group discussions on products for a broad range of Apple audiences. Helps develop and review public relations and marketing communications materials such as collateral, press releases, and data sheets. Independently identifies and analyzes the possible impact of competitive/3rd party products on Apple's products and makes recommendations as needed. Has expert knowledge of competitive and 3rd party products and competitor strategy. Plays a key role in new product announcement events. Time management and prioritization skills are critical.
